page.title: 11GREEN BELT - CONSERVATION.
page.content: THE GREEN BELT and CONSERVATION. From the{earliest days}when{"Chinewerde"}as it was{recorded in the 1086 Domesday {Book Kenilworth}has{grown}from a tiny {hamlet}of peasant cottages serving the Castle to a thriving,{modern town of {today}possessing some{20 thousand {inhabitants.}The{growth}of the{town has{accelerated considerably}since 1960.{New housing estates}both to the {East and West}of the town have resulted in the{loss}of{much valuable {farming land.}Indeed such has been the {rate of development}over the past {five years}to the{East}that a bare{mile only}of{Green Belt land{separates}the{town}from the outskirts of the nearby city of {Coventry.}During the{past few years {pressure groups}been{formed to protect {such land}from{future housing}or {industrial development.
